> needs entities to play. Let me clarify with a example: Suppose I want
> make a GUI in HTML; well, in my paradigm, everything begins from a
> entity. I need a entity to have a GUI. Than I make a "state machine"
> that receive as "primal material" the entity and as result I have a
> GUI. In this point I know what to wait from the "state machine", than
> I begins to produce the "state machine", testing your result visually

/*
* DynamicTableModelTest.java
* JUnit based test
*
* Created on 27 de Outubro de 2006, 15:17
*/

package br.com.cyberzen.fujiyama.tools;

import br.com.cyberzen.fujiyama.model.DescriptionAnnotation;
import br.com.cyberzen.fujiyama.model.LabelAnnotation;
import javax.swing.event.TableModelEvent;
import junit.framework.*;
import java.beans.IntrospectionException;
import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
import javax.swing.event.TableModelListener;
import javax.swing.table.TableModel;

/**
*
* @author Luiz Siqueira Neto
*/
public class DynamicTableModelTest extends TestCase {

private EntityIntrospector _entityIntrospector = null;
private DynamicTableModel _dynamicTableModel = null;
private MockEntity[] _mockEntityList = null;

public DynamicTableModelTest(String testName) {
super(testName);
}

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(DynamicTableModelTest.class);

return suite;
}

protected void setUp()
throws Exception {

MockContainer mockContainer = new MockContainer();
_entityIntrospector = new EntityIntrospector(mockContainer);
_mockEntityList = new MockEntity[4];
_mockEntityList[0] = new MockEntity();
_mockEntityList[1] = new MockEntity();
_mockEntityList[2] = new MockEntity();
_mockEntityList[3] = new MockEntity();
mockContainer.setItems(_mockEntityList);
_dynamicTableModel = new DynamicTableModel(_entityIntrospector);
}

public void testGetRowCount() {
System.out.println("getRowCount");

DynamicTableModel instance = _dynamicTableModel;

int expResult = 4;
int result = instance.getRowCount();

assertEquals(expResult, result);
}

public void testGetColumnCount() {
System.out.println("getColumnCount");

DynamicTableModel instance = _dynamicTableModel;

int expResult = 4;
int result = instance.getColumnCount();
assertEquals(expResult, result);
}

public void testGetColumnName() {
System.out.println("getColumnName");

int columnIndex = 0;
DynamicTableModel instance = _dynamicTableModel;

String expResult = "Name";
String result = instance.getColumnName(columnIndex);
assertEquals(expResult, result);
}

public void testGetColumnClass() {
System.out.println("getColumnClass");

int columnIndex = 0;
DynamicTableModel instance = _dynamicTableModel;

Class expResult = String.class;
Class result = instance.getColumnClass(columnIndex);
assertEquals(expResult, result);
}

public void testIsCellEditable() {
System.out.println("isCellEditable");

int rowIndex = 0;
int columnIndex = 3;
DynamicTableModel instance = _dynamicTableModel;

boolean expResult = false;
boolean result = instance.isCellEditable(rowIndex, columnIndex);
assertEquals(expResult, result);

expResult = true;
columnIndex = 2;
result = instance.isCellEditable(rowIndex, columnIndex);
assertEquals(expResult, result);
}

public void testGetValueAt()
throws
IllegalAccessException,
InvocationTargetException {
System.out.println("getValueAt");

int rowIndex = 0;
int columnIndex = 0;
DynamicTableModel instance = _dynamicTableModel;

_mockEntityList[0].setName("Luiz Siqueira Neto");
Object expResult = "Luiz Siqueira Neto";
Object result = instance.getValueAt(rowIndex, columnIndex);
assertEquals(expResult, result);
}

public void testGetEntityByIndex() {
System.out.println("getEntityByIndex");

int index = 0;
DynamicTableModel instance = _dynamicTableModel;

Object expResult = _mockEntityList[0];
Object result = instance.getEntityByIndex(index);
assertEquals(expResult, result);
}

public void testSetValueAt() {
System.out.println("setValueAt");

Object aValue = "Luiz Siqueira Neto";
int rowIndex = 0;
int columnIndex = 0;
String result = null;
String expResult = null;
DynamicTableModel instance = _dynamicTableModel;

instance.setValueAt(aValue, rowIndex, columnIndex);

result = _mockEntityList[0].getName();
expResult = (String) aValue;

assertEquals(expResult, result);
}

public void testAddTableModelListener() {
System.out.println("addTableModelListener");

boolean result = false;

MockTableModelListener l = new MockTableModelListener();
DynamicTableModel instance = _dynamicTableModel;

instance.addTableModelListener(l);
instance.fireTableCellUpdated(1, 1);
result = (l.column == 1) && (l.row == 1);
assertTrue(result);

instance.removeTableModelListener(l);
instance.fireTableCellUpdated(0, 0);
result = (l.column == 1) && (l.row == 1);
assertTrue(result);
}
}

// <editor-fold defaultstate="collapsed" desc=" Mock container ">
@LabelAnnotation("Mock container")
@DescriptionAnnotation("A container for make a test in EntityPanel")
class MockContainer {

private MockEntity[] _items = null;

@LabelAnnotation("mock entities")
@DescriptionAnnotation("a mock list")
public MockEntity[] getItems() {
return _items;
}

public void setItems(MockEntity[] mockEntityList) {
_items = mockEntityList;
}

public MockEntity getItems(int index) {
return _items[index];
}

public void setItems(int index, MockEntity mockEntity) {
_items[index] = mockEntity;
}

}
// </editor-fold>

// <editor-fold defaultstate="collapsed" desc=" Mock TableModelListener ">
class MockTableModelListener implements TableModelListener {

public int column = 0;
public int row = 0;

public void tableChanged(TableModelEvent e) {
column = e.getColumn();
row = e.getFirstRow();
}

}
// </editor-fold>
